tweet: I am thankful for the opportunity to represent the great people of #WA09. May we all remember the importance of family, friends, and community. #HappyThanksgiving!

We know the science. We know the urgency. Yet this Administration and the GOP continue to deny what we know to be true - that the future of the planet is dependent on our ability to drastically reduce greenhouse gas emissions and transition away from fossil fuels. https://twitter.com/nytimesworld/status/1199292736844828672 …

SNAP is the first line of defense against hunger and food insecurity for low-income families and children. I stand with @TheBlackCaucus to protect our nation’s children. #1MillionKids https://twitter.com/TheBlackCaucus/status/1199331976165101569 …

Community health centers are the backbone of care for low-income communities and millions of people across the country. It’s imperative we act to provide long-term reauthorization for this program. Read my op-ed in the @fwmirror. #ValueCHCs http://www.federalwaymirror.com/opinion/congress-cant-leave-community-health-centers-and-patients-behind/ …

Today marks the beginning of @UN’s 16 Days of Activism Against Gender-Based Violence. I’m proud to join @JanSchakowsky & 100+ of my colleagues in reintroducing the International Violence Against Women Act to increase U.S. efforts to combat gender-based violence. #IVAWA pic.twitter.com/zMZFpnBewk

Thank you to @Adoptees4Just for your tireless work advocating for the Adoptee Citizenship Act and lifting up the voices of impacted adoptees and their families. #NoAdopteesLeftBehind https://twitter.com/Adoptees4Just/status/1198688103990484992 …

@RepRobWoodall and I introduced the Adoptee Citizenship Act to grant these Americans the citizenship they should have always had – read more in our op-ed in @TheHill: https://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/politics/471784-congress-left-international-adoptees-behind-its-time-we-fix-it …
Through no fault of their own, thousands of international adoptees legally adopted as children by U.S. citizens were not granted American citizenship due to a flaw in our legal system.

Today on @Morning_Joe, I discussed Trump's feckless attempt to withhold critical, congressionally-authorized military assistance for his personal political gain. I joined over 130 of my colleagues to demand the Senate to hold a vote on bipartisan gun violence prevention legislation. H.R. 8 and H.R. 1112 passed the House more than 260 days ago – Leader McConnell and Senate Republicans must pass these critical, life-saving bills. pic.twitter.com/ebX9NCn7ny

It was great to speak with @MarkRuffalo today about PFAS. Thank you for using your platform to protect our environment and I look forward to continuing this work together.

Latinas on average make 54 cents on the dollar compared to white, non-Hispanic men. Latinas deserve to be paid the same as their colleagues, dollar for dollar. The Senate must pass the #PaycheckFairnessAct. #LatinaEqualPayDay

Support for aid to Ukraine is a tenet of U.S. foreign policy. Republicans and Democrats agree that strong and independent Ukraine is vital in our efforts to counter Russian aggression. (2/2)

As LTC Vindman points out, the idea that Ukraine meddled in the 2016 elections is, in fact, “a Russian narrative that Putin has promoted.” Efforts to legitimize this narrative jeopardize our national security and advance Russian interests. (1/2) pic.twitter.com/L7stbHjFYj

From LTC #Vindman a powerful reminder to Americans that we are uniquely fortunate to have a government based on rule of law & democratic values. We cannot take our democracy for granted, and we must protect it from those who wish to erode our norms and institutions. pic.twitter.com/O4AnAFcj7h

The diplomats representing the American people in posts around the world deserve the clarity, support, and protection from the White House and State Department. Anything less is a failure of leadership. pic.twitter.com/hjUWHhXzn4

It is unfortunate that some among us need this reminder, but here it is, from #MarieYovanovitch: 

“I would just remind, again, that our own U.S. intelligence community has conclusively determined that those who interfered in the election were in Russia.”
Threatening, demonizing, and undermining those who have dedicated their lives to the United States is dangerous, wrong, and deeply unpatriotic. (3/3)

Her testimony also highlights the instrumental role that career foreign service officers play in making our country safer. The knowledge & strength she brings to the table is emblematic of why we must support our diplomatic corps. (2/3)

Amb. Yovanovitch reminds us of an essential point: US-Ukraine relations are critical in the context of countering Russia’s malign actions, and Trump’s efforts to withhold aid for domestic political gain harmed US national security in no uncertain terms. (1/3)

“When other actors and countries see that private interests, foreign interests, can come together and get a U.S. Ambassador removed, what’s going to stop them from doing that in the future?” 

This question from true patriot Amb. Yovanovitch should trouble ALL Americans. pic.twitter.com/bzzTWA0PKC
I am hopeful that we can make progress towards a just immigration system that treats people with the dignity they deserve.
